The compressional behaviour has been investigated carrying out a symmetry-preserving relaxation procedure by exploring, at selected values of volume ( V), the minimum energy of the a/ b and c/ b ratios and internal coordinates [18]. Ten volumes between 0.86× V
init and 1.06× V
init (step of 0.02× V
init ) were considered for both Ca(OH) 2 and Mg(OH) 2, where V
init is the volume of the original optimized cell. Each model was then geometrically optimized. This approach has been successfully adopted for other mineral phases [6], [19].
